content: leg pick up the left leg of each stitch going down the column again many good online sources i ll add a few directions in the pattern and there s a mini tutorial at the end * * repeat the directions between the asterisks over and over hat #43 fish adult size v1 2 notes on color changes number of rounds i recommend doing at least 3 rounds of a color before changing to a new one this makes the color change look more even and natural slipping a stitch when you change colors in the round it creates a little jog to minimize this add the new color and knit a round on the 2nd round of the new color slip the first stitch purlwise without working it on the 3rd round and those after knit as normal adding a new color in ribbing when you connect stitches on the purl side of the work you can see the connection clearly when you connect colors in ribbing part of your stitches are in purl on the front of the work and you will see this ugly little 2 color line where the new color joins to avoid this do the following add a new color and do an entire round of only knit - right there in the middle of your ribbing you ll never notice it and on the next round just go back to your regular ribbing it ll look much better i promise a tip that helps me on short row - using a piece of scrap yarn when i come to the place to do my sw i complete the sw and turn now i m ready to work back before i start working and counting back to the next sw i hang a little piece of scrap yarn maybe 4 long in a contrast easy-to-see color over my needle then i work and count back to the next sw i work that sw and turn hang another piece of scrap yarn over the needle begin working and counting every time i do a turn i move the scrap yarn over to the new start-to-count place this way if i get lost in my counting or have to put my knitting down for a minute i can use that piece of scrap as a place to count from and find my place takes a little extra work but has been invaluable for me i know you can count from the sw but sometimes those are tricky to see a note on magic loop and turns in short row many of us using the magic loop method have only used it when doing knit stitches so we re familiar with where the yarn goes when we make that magic loop turn but with short row you ll necessarily be doing some purls after that magic loop turn this can get confusing if you over-think it basically this is the idea -
